revision.text: Possibly: The doctrine of permutations and combinations, being an essential and fundamental part of the doctrine of chances; As it is delivered by Mr. James Bernoulli, in his excellent Treatise on the Doctrine of Chances, intitled, Ars Conjectandi, and by the celebrated Dr. John Wallis, of Oxford, in a Tract intitled from the Subject, and published at the end of his Treatise on Algebra... (London : Sold by B. and J. White, Fleet-Street, 1795). http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2498585~S1
